@MichaelTX10 
China is only capitalist insofar as the government doesn't control 100% of the means of production and doesn't mandate everything be equal. The Chinese government accepts inequality in exchange for ordinary Chinese people getting richer as well. If that was not happening the government would just take the reins away those failing private companies.

@MichaelTX10 
China is not absolutely communist but that doesn't mean it's entirely capitalist either. It's a mix of the two. The Chinese government controls a very large amount of the Chinese economy and law/order is dictated by public servants, nothing else. That's a communist way of governance.

@doorwindow7 Dude, I'm Chinese. China calls itself a Republic, but technically, it's a republic. You elect representatives, and they make all the decisions. Besides, there's currency in China. So technically, it's not communist. I don't think that's happening anytime soon, although that's just my opinion.

@doorwindow7 
The US decides what is in its best interest. If we decide invading Vietnam is in our best interest (it was; we were trying to curb the treacle of communism), then it is in our best interest. Americans elect a government with the power to decide and the government decides. What I as a single American think is irrelevant.

@doorwindow7 
WMDs are a cause for existential worry in the United States and Al-Qaeda is a cause for worry too. Thus we bomb them. My point is that we didn't ASK anyone and even if you think it's illegal, it DOESN'T MATTER. America does what is in its best interest, foreigners be damned.

@inteli722

People who are outside our jurisdiction are those that do not have US citizenship. We cannot jail them for breaking our laws, they do not pay taxes, the list goes.
